sub_title: Director, Global Community Investment and YHP at AstraZeneca | Social Impact, Humanitarian Response, Global Giving
summary:
Leader of award-winning, measured, impactful healthcare initiatives and high-profile partnerships to strengthen health systems and improve health outcomes. Global Director of AstraZeneca’s community investment portfolio, including financial donations, medicine donation, disaster & humanitarian relief, product donation and employee volunteerism worldwide.

Manages the company’s global foundation and philanthropic initiatives covering 50+ countries and reaching millions of people each year, with a focus on supporting the most vulnerable communities (8-figure annual budget management and allocation). Subject matter expert on community investment governance and setting global policy in a highly regulated environment, overseeing the external disclosure process of >$100MM annually. Led the expansion of programming into 20+ countries and forged new long-term partnerships to drive significant social impact and employee engagement. Leads responsible medicine donation to communities in need through efficient disaster and humanitarian response and author of AstraZeneca’s Disaster Response SOP.

Member of PQMD’s Steering Committee on Disaster & Humanitarian Relief and Guidelines Committee for medical donations. 

Thought leader / speaker on social impact, youth leadership, diversity & inclusion, medical and financial donations, and supporting the healthcare needs of the most vulnerable populations.

awards.title: IMF Fellowship
awards.description: Selected from a pool of 700 global applicants, the IMF Fellowship gives the opportunity to become part of the global efforts to build forward better and join the IMF at the forefront of the response to the COVID-19 crisis. Participants will have a firsthand experience by joining the IMF Annual Meetings and given access to attend training led by IMF experts and media professionals from the Financial Times, Politico and others to boost their skills as multimedia storytellers in the current economic environment focusing on building a better future for youth.

projects.title: Trade Mission: Private-Sector Led to the Republic of Ireland and Northern Ireland
projects.description:
The Trade Mission was an important way to strengthen ties between U.S. corporations, Irish-Americans, Northern Ireland, and the Republic of Ireland that may unlock possibilities of trading, partnerships, and new markets. The mission had a remarkable blend of business, philanthropic site visits and of course a good bit of craic!

Sean Gaffey, Board Member of the Irish International Business Network (IIBN) in New York City, led a trade mission to Dublin, Belfast, and Derry-Londonderry last week with a group of private-sector delegates aimed at building relationships, trade, and investment the U.S. and Ireland.
Along with Sean, the delegation comprised of Jack Cline, Director of Federal Relations for the University of Kansas, Colin Cuneo, Partner, Cuneo and Co., David Evans, Managing Director of Canyon CTS, Donard Gaynor, Senior Executive, Consultant, and Non-Executive Director for multiple companies including Glanbia and H&K International, Robin Shapiro, serial entrepreneur and CEO of Get STiKi, and Courtney Sunna, VP of Sales for Allergy Standards Ltd. and IIBN Future Leaders Board Member.

courses.name: PQMD: Global Health & Development Essentials, Executive Course for Medical Product Donation Professionals

profile_positions.title: Director, Global Community Investment & Young Health Programme

profile_positions.description: Shaping and executing the company's approach to non-communicable disease (NCD) prevention and leading its $35M global community investment initiative, the Young Health Programme (YHP). YHP is a wholistic, integrated programme that combines research, advocacy, supports young leaders and invests in community programming in 35+ countries with 30+ non-profit partners to deliver sustainable impact. Together, we are helping to secure a future where all people have access to affordable, sustainable healthcare.
profile_positions.title: Assoc. Director, Global Sustainability, Access to Healthcare

profile_positions.location: Cambridge, UK (Based in The Hague, Netherlands)
profile_positions.title: Manager, Global Community Investment & Philanthropy

profile_positions.description: The Partnership for Quality Medical Donations (PQMD) develops and champions high standards in medicine and medical equipment donations. This unique alliance of non-profit and corporate organizations promotes sustainable and measurable access to quality health care in under-served communities and populations in crisis.
profile_positions.title: Disaster & Humanitarian Response Committee; Guidelines Committe

profile_positions.description: LEAP is a nonprofit women's leadership development program for Irish & Irish-American women and is supported by Ireland's Department of Foreign Affairs, Grant Thornton and Bank of Ireland. It was launched with the support of Ambassador Geraldine Byrne-Nason, Permanent Representative of Ireland to the United Nations and Chair of the UN's Commission on the Status of Women. Focused on helping mid-career professionals excel in their careers by providing workshops on negotiation, persuasion resilience, public speaking, personal and business finance, mentorship, and social impact. A component of the program, LEAP in the Community, pairs the women with local non-profits to help them solve business challenges and gain a broad understanding of corporate social responsibility and the important of giving back. Measurable social return on impact (1:24 ratio) of $2.8M and was recognized by One Young World and global media outlets.
profile_positions.title: Director

volunteer_experiences.description: Member of the international development programming board for the World Humanitarian Forum (WHF), the largest and most inclusive nonpartisan forum in humanitarian aid and international development. WHF brings together decision-makers and opinion-formers in the public, private and non- profit sectors, as well as the next generation of partnership-builders.

Selected from a pool of 700 global applicants, the IMF Fellowship gives the opportunity to become part of the global efforts to build forward better and join the IMF at the forefront of the response to the COVID-19 crisis. Participants will have a firsthand experience by joining the IMF Annual Meetings and given access to attend training led by IMF experts and media professionals from the Financial Times, Politico and others to boost their skills as multimedia storytellers in the current economic environment focusing on building a better future for youth.

LEAP is a nonprofit women's leadership development program which was recognized by the United Nations for our impact towards the Sustainable Development Goals. Focused on helping mid-career professionals excel in their careers by providing workshops on negotiation, persuasion resilience, public speaking, personal and business finance, mentorship, and social impact. Measurable social return on impact (1:24 ratio) of $2,800,000 in 2019 and was recognized by One Young World and global media outlets

One Young World is the preeminent global forum for young leaders and gathers the brightest young leaders from around the world to develop solutions to the world's most pressing issues. 

"The world's most impactful youth leadership Summit" - VICE
"An unparalleled network of leaders from every corner of the world" - Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau
"The best think tank imaginable" - Meghan Markle, Duchess of Sussex
"Stimulating, exciting and wonderful - full of ideas and entrepreneurialism" - President Bill Clinton

company.name: Boston College Center for Corporate Citizenship

volunteer_experiences.description: Based under the Carroll School of Management at Boston College, the Boston College Center for Corporate Citizenship is a membership-supported organization dedicated to advancing the field of corporate citizenship.

Board Of Directors : Dec 2018 - 2020
Chair, Future Leaders Board : Jan 2018 – Dec 2018
Future Leaders Board Member : Jan 2017 – Jan 2018

IIBN is a global, not for profit organization which brings together the elite of Irish and Irish-American business men and women. Over the last 10 years we have facilitated thousands of business introductions, hosted hundreds of networking events in London, Dublin and New York and have mentored hundreds of the next generation of future Irish & Irish-American entrepreneurs

volunteer_experiences.role: Youth Assembly Delegate for Innovation and Sustainability
volunteer_experiences.description: The Youth Assembly brings together global young leaders and changemakers to tackle groundbreaking solutions and foster real action for sustainable development, held on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly. We are emerging change-makers, social innovators, advocates, development practitioners, and leaders in our communities and the world at large.
Young Health Programme scholars are selected to participate in the One Young World Summit from a pool of tens-of-thousands of applicants from more than 150 countries.
Advisory Group to the Core Group at UN Women - for the Generation Equality forum

company.name: The NextGen Project | Empowering Cross-Generational Leadership & Collaboration

volunteer_experiences.description: The NextGen Project is a Think Tank aimed at growing a community of next generation leaders. We work in startups, corporations, and non-profits, and represent a diverse range of backgrounds and expertise. We mentor executives to discover what truly matters to the next generation of clients, employees and investors.

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-Founder, Young Health Programme Alumni Group
volunteer_experiences.description: An initiative within AstraZeneca Global Corporate Affairs is a community for young global leaders with a record of outstanding accomplishment, many are social entrepreneurs, all are working toward better health. Our members are Mandela Fellows, policy makers, award-winning entrepreneurs, nonprofit leaders, and strong female community leaders from Africa, Asia, the Middle East, North and South America, Europe. Workshops are run on public-private partnerships, grant writing, scaling up, digital skills, and global knowledge sharing.

volunteer_experiences.role: Mentor/Advisor to Social Impact Entrepreneurs and Refugee Entrepreneurs

company.name: One Young World, the Social Innovation Warehouse, and DELITE Labs

volunteer_experiences.description: -In partnership with One Young World and the Social Innovation Warehouse, I provide mentorship to social entrepreneurs as they scale-up, advising on operations, funding, building teams and branding. -With DELITELabs in Amsterdam, I participate as a Mentor to refugee and migrant entrepreneurs in Europe, through the Unilever/Ben & Jerry's funded "ICE Academy"
